intro: Jaundea pubescens var. oddonii, commonly known as the oddonii variant of the jaundea plant, is a rare and unique species native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow-green foliage and dense pubescence, which gives it a velvety texture. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in cloud forests or mountainous regions. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, with a waxy surface that helps retain moisture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
